result.execSummary:
The defendant Brooke T Fuchs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with TD w/o prior written approval of agent.

Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brooke T Fuchs

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney State Public Defender.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
